description.p: Network Manager is a Linux-native system and network profile manager inspired by NetSetMan Pro, redesigned for Linux best practices.

ul.li: Create unlimited network and system profiles
Switch configurations manually, automatically, or via CLI
Manage IP addresses, DNS, routes, VPN, Wi-Fi profiles
Configure system settings: hostname, proxy, firewall, printer
Auto-switch profiles based on conditions (SSID, gateway, time)
Pre/post scripts for advanced automation
Non-blocking, responsive GTK4/libadwaita interface

description.p: The application follows GNOME Human Interface Guidelines and uses a secure privilege separation model with Polkit authorization.

screenshot.caption: Dashboard showing current network status and active profile
Profile list with groups and status indicators

description.p: Security hardening, performance, and compatibility release:

ul.li: Argon2id key derivation for profile encryption (replaces raw SHA-256)
Random per-message salt added to every encrypted payload
Encryption passphrase is no longer persisted to disk
Config, cache, and log files now set strict 0600/0700 permissions
Key material is zeroed from memory on drop (zeroize)
Cryptographic nonces generated with OsRng
Sandbox mode now fails loudly when bwrap/firejail is missing
Removed shell-injection-prone execute_command(sh -c) API
Ping and DNS input validated against injection
Proxy settings check for GNOME schema before applying
Regex DoS protection with size-limited compilation
Compiled regexes cached across auto-switch cycles
Watchdog and auto-switch blocking calls offloaded from UI thread
Update checker response body size-limited to 512 KiB
Tokio runtime features narrowed to reduce binary size
DEB/RPM packages now declare NetworkManager dependency
Package architecture auto-detected from host (aarch64 support)
Bubblewrap uses existence check for /lib64 instead of hard bind

description.p: Major feature release with complete profile actions:

ul.li: Schedule profile activation with real profile selection
Hotkey binding to actual profiles for quick switching
Automatic scheduler execution at configured times
VPN disconnect, MTU, MAC address cloning support
DNS search domains configuration
Hostname and timezone configuration per profile
Default printer selection per profile
Environment variables per profile
Sandbox script execution (bubblewrap/flatpak)
Profile encryption with AES-256-GCM
Collapsible sidebar with icon-only mode
Automatic GitHub release checking
What's New section in About dialog
Improved card styling
Dashboard with network status overview
Profile creation and management
NetworkManager integration via D-Bus
System log viewer
Theme selector (system, light, dark)
Autostart support
